Hi Jean Marie Gagnon,    If you are using the PlusX pedals, the device is currently in SIMSONN Flasher mode. First, please make sure you are using SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.2. Then go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu to restore the device.  Also, please make sure to use the USB 3.0 (blue) port on the back of the PC, and do not use any USB hub.  The spark you see is just the motor capacitors charging. It is only 24V and completely safe — it will not damage the control box.  Regarding the software freezing issue, please follow these steps to resolve it:       If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi Jean Marie Gagnon,    Could you take a photo of the ground connection between your PC case, main control box, and pedals? I can help you check it. If the pedals get stuck, it’s usually caused by an unreliable ground connection.  You can download the VKB tool to test—it displays the pedal curves. Continuously press the pedals for 1–3 minutes; if the pedals get stuck, the curve will suddenly become a straight line. This helps determine whether the grounding issue is resolved.  If it turns out to be a problem with the main control box, we will replace it with a new one. However, in most cases, the issue is due to poor grounding.     https://www.vkbcontrollers.com/pages/downloads

Hi Jean Marie Gagnon,  ”I can not use the pedals anymore They stay frozen all the time “     Is your pedal having issues? We recommend manually updating the firmware again. Please follow the steps below:      Launch the latest version of SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2. On the “Plus X” control unit, press and hold the “Upgrade” button. While holding the button, unplug the USB cable from the PC and then plug it back in. The software should detect the device entering “SIMSONN Flasher update mode”. In the software go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update. In the file selector choose: pedals‑firmware → pedals‑plusx.sfu. Click “Start Update” and wait until the firmware is completely written. During this process do not disconnect the USB or close the application. Once the update is finished (you’ll get a success prompt or the unit will reboot), unplug and re‑plug the USB then test the pedal device to confirm everything works correctly.
